channel.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition
channel.description: CNN.com delivers up-to-the-minute news and information on the latest top stories, weather, entertainment, politics and more.

image.title: CNN.com - RSS Channel - App International Edition

channel.copyright: Copyright (c) 2020 Turner Broadcasting System, Inc. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Last weekend there were fires. This weekend there is dancing
Tens of thousands march in largest George Floyd protests so far in the US
item.description: Tens of thousands of people marched in cities and small towns across America in the largest demonstrations so far after George Floyd's death.

item.title: Behind the fortress walls in a defining week for Trump and the United States
Attorney for rookie cop charged in Floyd's death: This is bull****
item.description: The defense strategies of two of the former police officers who were charged in the death of George Floyd are emerging following a preliminary hearing. CNN's Josh Campbell reports.

item.title: The Mormon church's century-long mission to crack China
item.description: Every Sunday, when members of the Church of Jesus Christ of Latter-day Saints (LDS) meet in the conference room of a blue-glass skyscraper in downtown Shanghai, one person always takes a seat right at the back, by the doors.

item.title: People doing these 7 jobs are getting back to work faster than others
An asteroid the size of six football fields will speed by this weekend
item.description: An asteroid estimated to be the size of six football fields will whiz past Earth Saturday night -- but no, you're not in danger.

item.title: Trump just showed us what he'll be like after the election -- no matter what happens
item.description: The past week and its showcase of President Donald Trump's erratic behavior offered a window into how he would deal with defeat.

item.title: Looters able to target high-end stores in New York due to intelligence failure
item.description: Looters in New York City were able to tear through some of the most expensive, high-end stores in the city because of an intelligence failure, according to a high-ranking police official.

item.title: After reviewing video, prosecutors charge police inspector instead of protester
item.description: A Philadelphia police inspector is facing charges after prosecutors said a video shows him striking a student protester on the head with a metal baton.

item.title: Portland is the latest city to suspend the use of tear gas on protesters
item.description: Police in Portland, Oregon, won't use tear gas to disperse crowds, becoming the latest city to order the tactical change amid the ongoing nationwide protests against police brutality.

item.title: Buffalo police officers plead not guilty to assaulting 75-year-old man at demonstration
Must-watch videos of the week
Fox News under fire for stock market graphic
item.description: A graphic aired by Fox News that compared the stock market performance after high-profile cases of violence against black men. CNN's Brian Stelter and Victor Blackwell discuss.

item.title: No taller than 500M, no plagiarism: China signals 'new era' for architecture
item.description: An end to "copycat" buildings and a ban on skyscrapers taller than 500 meters (1,640 feet) are among the Chinese government's new guidelines for architects, property developers and urban planners.

item.title: Why do police officers still lie when videos often contradict what they say in reports?
item.description: A video showed officers in Buffalo, New York, pushing a 75-year-old man. Police initially said he had tripped and fell.

item.title: Bayern Munich sports armbands in solidarity with Black Lives Matter movement
item.description: With its players sporting armbands supporting the Black Lives Matter movement, Bayern Munich maintained its seven-point lead atop the Bundesliga with a 4-2 win at fifth-placed Bayer Leverkusen Saturday.

item.title: Woman body slammed by police officer
item.description: An Atlanta police officer was caught on camera slamming a woman to the ground during protests on May 29, in the nearby community of Buckhead.

item.title: Updates from around the world
Joe Biden wins enough delegates to secure Democratic nomination
item.description: Former Vice President Joe Biden has earned enough delegates to officially secure the Democratic nomination for president, CNN projected on Saturday.

item.title: Justin Trudeau takes a knee at Black Lives Matter demonstration on Parliament Hill
item.description: Canadian Prime Minister Justin Trudeau took a knee during a Black Lives Matter demonstration in Ottawa on Friday.

item.title: She wrote a fantasy novel about a dystopian New York City. Then it came true
item.description: Sometimes, books come at exactly the right time, and that is certainly the case with "The City We Became," the first book in N.K. Jemisin's "Great Cities" trilogy. The fantasy novel is based on the idea that the essence of New York City is transferred to six humans -- each an avatar for the five boroughs and one for the city as a whole -- who must protect the city, and its people, from an intergalactic multi-dimensional threat that manifests as a gentrifying Woman in White. No one knows how the pandemic-battered New York will fare in the coming months or years, but Jemisin points to the solidarity and resiliency of the city.

item.title: Fire devastates Amazon distribution center
item.description: A warehouse that operates as an Amazon distribution center went up in flames after a three-alarm fire broke out, engulfing the entire building. Thick plumes of smoke could be seen coming out of the building in Redlands, California, as firefighters battled back the flames.

item.title: A bishop in Texas kneeled in prayer for George Floyd. Two days later, Pope Francis called
item.description: Catholic Bishop Mark Seitz had no idea that his act of solidarity in El Paso, Texas, would be met with a phone call of gratitude from his boss, Pope Francis.

item.title: The pain and possibility of thwarted gay pride celebrations
item.description: The mood of the coronavirus pandemic is the precise opposite of the mood of a Pride celebration. The former is defined by monotony, isolation, and anxiety; the latter by movement, touch, and joy.

item.title: Growing number of videos emerge showing police incidents
item.description: After days of protests across the country, a growing number of disturbing incidents involving the police caught on video are emerging. CNN's Jason Carroll reports.

item.title: This is what the Black Lives Matter protests look like in Australia
item.description: Protesters have gathered in major cities across Australia demanding justice over minority deaths in police custody in solidarity with the Black Lives Matter movement.

item.title: Two New York lawyers are in custody in connection with a Molotov cocktail attack on a police patrol car during weekend protests
item.description: Two attorneys were taken back into custody Friday for charges in connection with a Molotov cocktail attack on a police patrol car during protests in Brooklyn last weekend in the wake of George Floyd's death.

item.title: Kids are born biased but parents can keep it from mutating into racism
item.description: As the United States erupts in protests and push back against systemic racism, parents are worried. Parents of black kids navigate far more fundamental worries and much higher stakes, fearing that their children's lives will be taken for jogging, driving, even sleeping in their own homes.

item.title: NFL star Drew Brees tells Trump protests have never been about the US flag
German tourists fined for swimming in Venice's Grand Canal
item.description: A pair of German tourists who swam in Venice's Grand Canal have been fined $790 and removed from the city, Italian police told CNN Friday.

item.title: Video shows a woman being body slammed by an Atlanta police officer as she was handcuffed
item.description: An Atlanta police officer seen on a video posted by the Atlanta Journal-Constitution body slamming a woman on the first night of protests in Atlanta has been placed on administrative assignment, police said.

item.title: What's in a name? California restaurant agrees to a change amid national unrest
item.description: Sixty-three years ago, a pancake house opened in California that spawned a nationwide restaurant chain.

item.title: Public shaming has become a common pastime during the pandemic. But it doesn't really work
item.description: Public shaming, in this era of rapid judgment and ensuing internet outrage, is nothing new. But the pandemic has made it a popular pastime.

item.title: Trump tried to rewrite reality on the protests. Here are the facts
item.description: Facts First: CNN's Daniel Dale fact checks President Trump's comments about protests happening across the country as well as right outside the White House.

item.title: 'Black Lives Matter' painted on road leading to White House
item.description: Washington DC is painting a message in giant, yellow letters down a busy DC street ahead of a planned protest this weekend: BLACK LIVES MATTER.

item.title: Prince William has been secretly volunteering for a mental crisis hotline
item.description: Prince William, Duke of Cambridge, revealed he has secretly been volunteering to assist people struggling with mental health issues during the coronavirus lockdown.

item.title: The art world is trying to protect artwork amid civil unrest and support community unity
item.description: For more than a week Americans have flooded the streets of major metropolitan areas across the country in protest of racially-motivated police brutality sparked by George Floyd's death in police custody.

item.title: D-Day invasion rare photos reveal the chronology of events
item.description: Operation Overlord was launched over 76 years ago on June 6, 1944. Commonly known as D-Day -- a military term for the first day of a combat operation -- it was the largest seaborne invasion in history and it kick-started the Battle of Normandy, which successfully opened a second, Western front in Nazi-occupied Europe.

item.title: Olympic hopeful on working two jobs to achieve her sporting ambitions
item.description: Working two jobs is a lot for anyone to take on, let alone an elite athlete on a mission to make her first Olympic Games.

item.title: The world's best egg dishes
item.description: Which came first, the chicken or the egg? If we're talking menus, you might be inclined to say "egg," if only for its ubiquity at breakfast. But the egg is the star of many other meals, too, and it is beloved for its workhorse qualities in recipes the world over.

item.title: Feeling hopeless after a tough week? Here are 5 things that may help
item.description: It's been an extraordinary week in America, as anger, pain and heartbreak have swept across the country over the killing of yet another black man at the hands of police.

item.title: The US President stays inside an increasingly fortified White House as crises outside converge
item.description: On Monday, the percussive bang of flash grenades echoed in the Rose Garden and an acrid odor from chemical dispersant wafted over a presidential photo opportunity.

item.title: White House wanted 10,000 active duty troops to quell protesters
item.description: The White House wanted to have 10,000 active duty troops on the streets of Washington and other cities earlier this week to quell protesters, but Secretary of Defense Mark Esper and Chairman of the Joint of Chiefs of Staff General Mark Milley pushed back at the use of any active duty troops, according to a senior defense official.

item.title: Trump's response to protests knocked US off its moral soapbox
With a shocking invocation of George Floyd, Trump shows his disconnect from nation's pain
item.description: President Donald Trump showed his breathtaking disconnect from the pain and tumult that has unfolded in this country after George Floyd's death, declaring Friday that new economic numbers and nationwide protests against racism and police brutality had made it "a great day" for Floyd.

item.title: Last weekend there were fires. This weekend there is dancing
item.description: • Tens of thousands march in largest George Floyd protests so far in the US

item.title: Chinese soccer legend calls for the downfall of the Communist Party in videos
item.description: A retired Chinese soccer star has openly called for the downfall of China's ruling Communist Party, in what he says was the "biggest and most correct decision" of his life.

item.title: Teen who spent 10 hours cleaning up after protest is rewarded with car and scholarship
item.description: When Antonio Gwynn Jr. saw the damage from protests in his hometown of Buffalo, New York, he grabbed a broom, bought some trash bags and started cleaning the streets by himself.

item.title: Police officers plead not guilty to assaulting 75-year-old man
item.description: • 57 officers quit unit after 2 suspended
